intro: Hymenocoleus multinervis, commonly known as the multivened hymenocoleus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominent venation. Its small, white to pink flowers are clustered in cymes and are often fragrant. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal in the wild.
